Uses of Class
arma.Op

    • Uses of Op in arma

      Methods in arma that return Op 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Op Op.valueOf(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
      static Op[] Op.values()
      Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.
      Methods in arma with parameters of type Op 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Mat.at(int i, int j, Op operator)
      Performs a unary operation on the value of the element at the ith row and jth column and overwrites it with the result.
      void Mat.at(int i, int j, Op operator, double operand)
      Performs a right-hand side operation on the value of the element at the ith row and jth column and overwrites it with the result.
      void Mat.at(int n, Op operator)
      Performs a unary operation on the value of the nth element of a column-major-ordered one-dimensional view of the matrix and overwrites it with the result.
      void Mat.at(int n, Op operation, double operand)
      Performs a right-hand side operation on the value of the nth element of a column-major-ordered one-dimensional view of the matrix and overwrites it with the result.

      Non-canonical: Returns true if the evaluation of a operator b holds true and false otherwise.

      Non-canonical: Creates a column vector containing a 1 for each element for which the evaluation of a operator b holds true and 0 otherwise.
